reviews.review_msg: Tough marker

Fantastic professor! I took a course with him online and he couldn't have been more helpful and kind. Responds to emails same day and with a thorough answer. Extremely knowledgeable and his feedback is useful/will make you a better writer/thinker. Fair marker. Would definitely recommend!
Great guy and very knowledgable. Lectures were a little boring but so was the course topic so it wasn't really his fault. Would take again no doubt.
Scott's tests were fair but be prepared to read the text, it is vital to doing well
hard exams which he doesn't prepare his students for at all and unfair marking

Took his pol 221 course online. This was my first distance ed class but it was a fair class. Not very available in terms of office hours etc, but exams and research papers are very fair with clear grading criteria. Would definitely take a class with him again.
Knows quite a bit about his topic. Good in class discussion, encourages attendance and debate. Agreed, is hot, but taken. Worth checking out his class, if you like participating.
He can be a bit monotonous but he's really interested in the subject and encourages class participation. Also, I suggest attending lecture(very worth it)

Clarke was a bit of a jerk.  Essentially his lectures are boring and pointless, he answers students questions with 10-15 minute tangents, he is unhelpful and uncaring in extenuating circumstances, and he takes criticism in class poorly (lashing out at me personally on more than one occasion).  So far worst lecturer in SFU's Political Science dept.

Zomg, when I first met him I thought he would be a fun and outgoing guy, boy, I was dead wrong. This guy is the biggest bookworm. He seems to spend way too much time in the library and not in the real world. He knows his stuff but gawd does he make it boring. Lectures are only of the most minimal value. He is not that helpful when u go and see him.

Dr. Greg Clarke, after he defended his Phd thesis, appeared somewhat friendly, but had a lot of difficulty engaging the class. I think I almost feel asleep once!The TA(Paul Weaver) was quite a difficult marker; I believe the average mark after the final exam would be a B- or a c+. Big disappointment

He was a decent professor but wasn't clear at structuring exactly what was testable. The TA (curry) was the hardest marker ive ever come across. Even if you got the basics of the answer right. (text book answer) you still only got a 1.5 or 2 out of 5 (50% - 66%) talk about an easy way to bring doen a average. marking scheme was crappy.
Yeah, the eye thing, and he also mumbles alot. But a really nice guy.
He totally has a problem with his eyes

Kind and personable professor however RIDICULOUSLY tough on essay marking for lower-division PoliSci courses; as if you're a Master's student. Gives no detailed criteria for marking. Spare your GPA the unnecessary hit and AVOID

Heard is a really funny professor who definitely knows a lot about what he's teaching. Exams are really fair, and he records lectures and puts them online if you're sick. The term paper is lengthy, with a lot of research requirements, but it's not that bad. Grading is a bit harder than usual, but not crushing. Overall, a good prof for POL221!

Amazing lectures. Really funny guy. Very knowledgeable and definitely prominent in his field. He does grade fairly difficultly as others have noted and the paper is pretty long but not too bad. His tests aren't too bad; all written from a pool that you can choose from.  He records his lectures  Audio/Video/Slides which is nice.

excellent lecturer. he wants you to do well, but will make you work your ass off for it. he's also super tough on papers, so be sure you triple-check your writing. other than that, I retained most of the information he taught during class, and seriously helped me build a vital fundamental knowledge base for upper-division polisci courses.

Nice guy, but by far he is one of the hardest markers I have had. I am a third year and for a 200 level course he marks it like a 400. If you dont mind hard marking, hes the one for you. Hes a nice guy and lecture notes are posted online.
Great professor with clear explanation of topics in lectures!
Great professor!
Pretty fantastic. This course was easier than I expected, and Dr. Heard's clarity and humour made it all the better. I recommend this class!

Dr. Heard is great.  Takes what is possibly the most boring material ever prepared for a university course and makes it interesting.  Love the jokes.  He can actually keep you awake while talking about 'constitutional conventions.'  TA's are...adequate.
Dr. Heard is amazing. Great personality, takes stuff that is dry as chalk dust and keeps you awake.  Just fantastic.  His TA's on the other hand....lets just say that I don't care about hockey...
one of the best Pol profs at sfu. Friendly, funny, and not too difficult (if you know the basics).

took this prof for pol 100 last semester, and loved him. took 221 b/c of him this time, and hated him. lectures were boring, confusing and long-winded, midterm was impossibly difficult. prof lost all his humour from before. saving grace was the ta, kathy.
He is a really witty and funny lecturer. His marking was really though. Be prepared to do your best on the midterm because it takes a lot to get a good mark!
Best teacher yet, hilarious, extremely intelligent, I switched to pol b/c of him
No Comments
Interesting and funny lecture.  Nice professor and a good impersonator.

I think the reviewer below did not attend the same class that I did. Logan was an amazing lecturer. Gave us clear examples understand difficult issues. I do remember him saying outside of the course material.

Overall a good professor and a fair marker. He is clearly passionate and knowledgeable about the subject which is always nice. His tests never require you to remember years or any other numbers which is great.

After reading the review below, I have to disagree. Logan was very accommodating. I think the student below did not explain the situation to Logan/TA. Logan gave me an extension on the essay and also allowed me to push my grade component to the final exam.

Least understanding professor I've ever had! My mom passed away and he refused to give me an extension for my final paper and increased my final exam % to 50% because I missed one test because I was at my mom's funeral. WORST TEACHER, NOT UNDERSTANDING AT ALL, GAVE ME A REALLY HARD TIME while I was already struggling.

Yikes. This is probably the worst class I've taken ever. It was terribly organized and extremely poor communication on Dr. Elmose's part left my mental health in shambles. I would avoid her classes at all costs. Very dissapointing.

He is nice from what I can tell, and I think he tried really hard to adapt to the online environment but I don't think it's working for him. From awkward pauses to peculiar comments on assignments, Dr. Prest may suite some people better than others. He has high expectation for assignments, but doesn't give clear feedback.

If you ever have the opportunity to take a class with Stewart I recommend you don't! Perhaps he was just terrible because of the online environment this semester. But I probably wouldn't go with that assumption. He is very difficult marker and he cannot release or mark grades in a respectable time, plus he'll take forever to respond to an email. :

Very nice guy but somewhat disorganized on sending lecture notes. Course syllabus was not very useful or have relevant info on the weekly sessions. No info given on the term paper guideline or marking scheme. He just told us to pick a topic and analyze it. Not a fair marker either. Exams were short answer and essay type questions. Not enjoyable.
excellent course, enjoyed the project with city studio
Very helpful in office hours, will go out of her way to help. The classes were always very well structured and engaging......  Occasionally boring (but I did have 3 hour lectures from 3-6pm..)

Hey is a great research prof yes, but what people need to understand about this man is that he focuses on research to help you understand the concepts presented in the course and to take it further. Attending lectures yes, are useless to go to.

well, where to start....His exams are a complete joke!!! i think he just opens the text book and pick the first thing he     reads.. he can spend two weeks talking about a concept in class and then not have a singe question on that on the exam!!!

He pontificates on the evils of anything even remotely right-winged or moderate.  He is totally biased, has irrelevant lectures, and is a radical left wing zealot.  If you're not insanely in love with socialist atheism, this prof is not for you.  If you have to suffer through his lectures bring a pillow.
